review: I actually rate them 3.5... I love this place, so much that I go with my family 2-3 times a month. We love their fries, we always ask for a couple refills of it because we like it so much but... we had a couple or I should say.. a few bad servers, but now we know them so we try to avoid them. We did had a few times the same server, I don't know her name but we didn't had to ask for refills on our soda or fries, she was fantastic.  The manager or supervisor is great, I really like his customer service, I wish all the servers were like him. Probably if they had better CS we will go more often.

The service was great, the waitress was really on top of things and quick. I had a problem with my Boca burger, which is a common problem with most restaurants (it's really easy to harden the patty-so I don't fault them) and I let them know, just an fyi type thing, not looking for anything in return, since I ate pretty much the whole damn burger anyway.  BUT the kitchen manager (Alan, I think) came out to talk to me about it, and he bought my burger for me.  It was really a  nice gesture, and I'll definitely be back! Thanks!
i ordered a veggie burger,, my patty was cold in the middle.. :(  my cousins were yummy . so hit n miss

Red Robin used to a great place. That was a long time ago.  It's no longer that way.  The staff are sloppy looking and unkempt. The food seems "assembled" and not "cooked" to order.  Service is awkward.   There is a feeling of "no pride" in providing great service and great food.  It's sad, it used to be that way in the 80's when the Kingen family owned. That's before the Japanese bought it and before it went public.  Now it's just another "crap on the wall" restaurant.  There are many restaurants that serve a better quality burger that are locally owned and ran by people that take pride in their work.
I think they need to change their customer service approach. They forget things on your order and then tell you they are sorry. Then never return. There are better choices in the area.

Came with a group of 4. There was a ton of seating but I believe they were trying to get an area for a party of 20 ready first? That's what I'm going with because perception shapes reality and almost as far as the eye could see, there were open booths. That being said, it took the waitress about two and half minutes to show up to take our drink order. Not that busy, mind you...the party of 20 had not arrived yet. The drinks, two lemonades and a glass of water came pretty quickly. Another of us ordered a hot water which came with a lipstick-infused mug. My favorite! I never trust dishwashers.  What was ordered: Bonsai Burger Riblets and Mac&Cheese Clucks & Fries Tavern Double While we waited, I received my first water refill...which was accompanied with miscellaneous floating remnants from...who knows what or where. Well, I mean, I suppose it'd be easy to deduce where but anyway...  I never trust dishwashers. Food all came within about ten minutes. From what I hear, everyone's food tasted good. Ill just speak on mine: riblets and mac. The macaroni was just your basic run of the mill spiral pasta and cheese sauce with cheddar cheese melted on top. It was baked, but for a couple minutes too long. Some of the noodles were crunchy. Not my bag. Then again neither is crisp(ier) bacon. In the end, I was eating macaroni and cheese and well...life is good when you're eating macaroni and cheese. There was also coleslaw on a bed of lettuce. I had a flavor issue with this one because I kept tasting onion. Texture was decent, however. The riblets had a nice tangy sauce draped all around the meat. It was the meal's saving grace. Meat was tender enough, not tough, but still didnt give me that marinated for hours and cooked to perfection feel. Ribs were small enough to go down in two to three bites. One if you wanted to Scooby Doo it, which wouldn't have been hard. Oh yea, the water was good. When it was water. And not accompanied by other stuff i side. Didn't have an after-taste either, which I'm a fan of. We had a young server. High school. So she hadn't been taught to care or remember things yet. She asked us if everything was ok about five times within a 15 minute period. At one point someone asked for an additional piece of lettuce because the lettuce that came with the burger was this dilapidated and rejected by all the other lettuce kids piece that really just...should have been in a salad. Waitress forgot about it. Then the spare lettuce from another meal was used and when we told the waitress we were good to go, she comes back with two and a half large "Honey, I Blew Up The lettuce" pieces. I seriously could have fed three rabbits and a guinea pig. Life actually seemed better when the waitress didn't come around. But...like I said, she's young and couldn't be bothered with...remembering things. One day...  Red Robins tend to get crowded quick and the booths aren't super huge. So put your left-handers on the inside if seated next to right-handers. Don't complicate life. A very large portion of the staff is young and up and coming in the work force so keep that in mind if you ever go here. You're not going to get five star service, but someone could surprise you. Never know. Considering its a Red Robin and they are rated #1 for Best Burger in some category I cared not to remember I should have gotten a burger. I mean, hey, the fries are bottomless.And who doesn't like a good bottomless fry? So why not a 5 star: lack of cleanliness (lipstick on mug, leftover from the last thing that was in there stuff in the water pitcher), sub-par and untrained customer service, and average tasting meal.

Visited in a Tuesday night. Merely an "okay" experience. Our originally dinner plan failed us so we resolved to Red Robins. It was our first time here and may be the last since there are other closer RR closer to us. This one was just out of convenience. We got dearly rather promptly, at most a 5 min wait. Party if two adults and a child. The place did look a bit pack and that's probably due to the timing we arrived.. HH.  Nonetheless, we got seated and few minutes later a sweat dripping waiter came by to assist us. We ordered our drinks and meals. Kiddo got the chuck chuck chicken (don't recall actual name of the fried chicken strips) freckled fruits and a soda. I got a burger (forgive me for not recalling any actual name..) that had fried onion, mushroom,  horseradish touch to it. My husband got the seafood platter ordeal.  We waited and understand it was probably a busy hour so food might take awhile and we appreciated our sweating waiter offer us some fried as we waited.  He came back but with the little ones' food. It was a nice gesture that they didn't want the lil one to be hungry. Unfortunately the time gap between our kids food and ours arriving was too big of a gap.  My husband said it would've been nice if we could eat with our son..  So another words, our kid was almost if not nearly done before our food arrive. We get our food, the burger was alright for me. Hubby enjoyed it more than I did. Fries were ok, some were not done enough.  The place appears to be "okay" overall. I do have to mention that this particular RR doesn't have the togo cups for the kids meal as they once did/ other places offer.  Now correct me of I'm wrong, bc I/we haven't gone to a RR for nearly 6 months, things may have changed OR it could've been just that particular franchise that decided to opt out on the kids meal togo cup for drinks. Even though there were no kiddie cup, they had a kid size plastic cup with a lid on it. Which does mean something for us. It's a necessity (in my opinion) makes everyone's life easier.  So like I've mentioned, we may stick with the RR in Tukwila or try out the one at the Landing.  Shall I mention, beginning of our meal/half way thru our waiter did wipe those sweating beads off his face and forehead. We give the guy an A for effort but everything else combined is what lead my review to a 3 star review.
Great service. The jalapeño pineapple mango salsa burger was delish!

Oh Red Robin, the place I go to for delicious fries and burgers.  This Kent location has become a new favorite among Red Robins for me. One reason is the parking lot. I'm pretty sure there's more spaces in this dedicated lot than restaurant capacity. I never have to fight for a parking space like I do in Bellevue, Renton, and Tukwila. The other nice thing is its big enough that I never have to wait more than five minutes for a seat. The servers are friendly as are the greeters. Besides that this is standard Red Robin fare. Typical decor, layout, and food. Consistency is good in a Red Robin!

We come here often after work and most always sit in the bar. I'm a fan of the food, but most nights, not a fan of the understaffed bar. The employees are very polite, nice, and as attentive as they can be for having so many tables. So, it usually takes a little longer to get anything, but we're rarely in a hurry when we go.

We always head to the bar for a fast seat. It's about time to refresh the board games / clean some of them. Upwords game was pretty raunchy.   Floor is sticky in ladies room, garbage can overflowing and one stall was down due to someone being sick on it.   The tables look clean in the bar but are always sticky on multiple visits. Please get it together, you are close to home and a Burger Fav.

This review is for THIS PARTICULAR Red Robin location. I've always had great service at other Red Robin restaurants but this one in Kent really pissed me off. First our group of 4 walked up to the bar and a server told us we had to leave because we weren't 21. She saw a kid walking into the bar in front of us and automatically assumed we were with the kid. She said it really loud too in an alarming way- like she was shocked we would think to even bring a kid to the bar. Everyone at the bar stopped and looked at us and I told the server we didn't know who the kid was and we were definitely over 21, probably over a decade older even than she was. Thanks for embarrassing us and then only giving a small apology under your breath! Our server herself was nice but it seemed she was stretched thin between multiple tables. But she took our orders pleasantly and another server brought our food and drinks. We asked for more dipping sauces but never got any back. I also asked for a small plate. That never showed up either. Essentially, after we got our food, none of the servers really checked on us or our drinks until we were practically done with our food. They were however busily helping the other tables.  A bus boy also noticed my friends shirt that said I  Love Guns and Coffee and blurted out "I guess you're a liberal!" Excuse me? If you are going to blurt out something political at least get it right..it's being a conservative! Not a liberal!  And it' was just one of those funny t-shirts. It doesn't at all dictate the political view of the person wearing it! While we were eating the bartender even yelled "Is it closing time yet?!?" Wow, really, there are customers at your establishment- good job making them feel you have to keep working! It was 2 hours from closing time! We asked for the bill, tipped and left but the whole experience was just horrid. We should have left the second the server assumed we weren't 21.  Servers need to get checked here. Don't tell everyone your opinion. Politely ask for ID if you are not sure  of the age of your customers. Don't make assumptions of your guests. We don't know you. You don't know us. We are there to eat. You are there to serve. We stuck to the program- we ordered, ate, paid. The servers there need to get with the program. I'm giving it two stars because the food was just as good as other Red Robin. Yep, no stars for service..just for food. The other three stars were eaten away by horrible service in a service industry business!  PS- we tipped the normal amount based on the bill. We really are too nice!!

Edit 9/26/2013:  The general manager gave me a call to request some additional information and resolve these issues.  He was genuinely surprised that cleanliness had deteriorated so much, and has not heard similar reports from other customers - but because he was very sincere in both his apology and commitment to correct these issues, I'm increasing my rating to 2 stars.  I'll definitely write another review if I decide to visit this location again. - - - I hadn't been to this Red Robin location for a couple years, but stopped by this evening with a few friends.  The restaurant wasn't very busy for a Sunday evening, perhaps 30-40 guests between the restaurant and bar, and plenty of staff:  Two front-of-house hostesses and several servers. There are several important parts to this review, so I'll jump ahead to the most important first: - Overall cleanliness has decreased significantly at this restaurant since the last time I was here.  Menus were slightly greasy, the on-table drink menu had large pieces of food/mayo on it, every single plate that arrived was covered with substantial greasy fingerprints from the cook staff. - The Royal Red Robin Burger no longer has a fried/fully cooked egg on top - instead, it's over easy, and on a burger re-make that I ordered, the white was so runny that it soaked into the bun. - Burgers are now served on a smaller plate, with a metal ring to hold the fries vertically.  This is probably a good thing for America's growing waistline, but fry portions are now ~50% smaller. - Burgers are about half the thickness as previously used.  Tonight, all our burgers were pre-frozen, but our server did not know if this was a permanent change, or why they changed.  It also raises the question of food safety for burgers with pink in the middle, since it's more difficult to get a frozen beef patty to 160 degrees while leaving pink.  Pre-formed/frozen patties are also much more dry than fresh burgers. Ok, on to our visit: The first thing we noticed was the drink menu was quite dirty, with several large pieces of food/mayonnaise on it.  We just handed these items to our waitress and she apologized. Most of us ordered burgers;  Two of us ordered the Royal Burger (bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg on top).  The other person ordered his with a little bit of pink, and I ordered mine well-done without mayonnaise.  When our food arrived, a different waitress brought it, but didn't know which order was which - we helped her examine the burgers and determined which one was missing the mayo.  But they got the burgers switched - mine was quite rare, all the way to the very edges.  This is gross (personal preference), and possibly not safe to eat if the temperature wasn't verified. Unfortunately, we were unable to get the attention of a server for ~10 minutes, so most of my party was half-finished with their burger when I was finally able to send it back. Our server did offer me an extra plate of fries while I waited, so at least they showed that they don't hate their customers.  (+1 star). The manager brought my replacement burger, and he must have just come in from a smoke break - the cigarette smoke as he spoke to us was extremely strong.  (Everyone at the table could smell it, but since he was talking to me, it took my breath away). They did cut the burger in half this time, so I could see the meat was done.  But as soon as I bit into the burger, I had a mouth full of raw egg white.  It was soaked into the top bun which made it soggy with raw egg.  I couldn't get the attention of any servers or the manager again for more than 10 minutes, so I ended up just not eating the burger. Eventually when it came to pay the bill, the server did not ask any questions about my un-eaten burger.  She also didn't ask if I'd like a box, so she must have known something wasn't up to par with the replacement burger. I don't think any of us will return to this Red Robin location again;  Perhaps we'll give the Tukwila location a try.

Years ago we visited this restaurant often.  Last week I went for lunch at noon and not only was the parking lot almost empty, it was littered with garbage.  The condition continued as I went inside.  It looked old, tired and dirty.  The food was okay, but portions small and the price was ridiculous for what we had.  There are a lot better options not far away so we won't be returning again.
Took my family for dinner this week. Service was fast. Food was good.  Our waitress (Alyssa?) was awesome and funny.  We frequent this Red Robin a few times per month.

The good - I have always been a fan of red robin and have visted all the local location at one time or another. Bacon burger and fries or clucks and fries are always good. Mixed drinks are always good. Usually we are seated right away.  The bad -  Last couple times it seemed alittle dirtier . The restroom trash was overflowing and both of the automatic paper towel holders were either empty or non functioning. Service varies depending on waiter. Cleaning resteraunt will get you more stars

A friend and I came to this location Saturday night and we received horrible service. We sat in the bar area. Maybe our waiter was having a bad day or she hates her job but we did not receive a good customer service and we were a little disappointed by that (I still tipped). Food was good, its Red Robin. I like the new freckled strawberry lemonade with Absolut vodka :-)

I'm officially done with this particular Red Robin location. The last 3 or 4 times I've been here, the service has been really slow and the taste/quality of the food has been lacking. Yes, the burgers are yummy, but this particular location has been a frustrating mess for the past couple of months. I'm going to find a new Red Robin location to get my burger fix.

This review is nothing bad about the service of our server. Rather my major complaints were with the management and support he received.  Our server once he noticed (known told him we were seated) that we were seated in the bar section came right over and began to take our order and told us about the special. (Tavern Tuesday or something). Our food was prompt and hot. However I had ordered a dipping sauce with my fries and it wasn't with the food. I told our server and he quickly tried to get me the sauce however in the time we sat down. Our server got 7 more tables. I used to work in food service so I know how hard it to juggle a few tables and he wasn't getting any support. I also think that the management might want a little foresight and maybe have more than one person on the floor for happy hour? I never got my sauce and our server was genuinely upset. He did discount my check (which was unnecessary) I do want to say good job to the server to pull a 3 star review out of a 1 star experience.

I usually love red robin and have gotten to-go orders from many locations.  This location did not deliver on their "gourmet burger" reputation.  The "medium rare" burger was burnt to a crisp and tasted awful due to the blackened char surrounding it.  The cheese, sauce and condiments were only on half of the burger, looking as if they had thrown it together in 2 seconds. There were a total of maybe 7 hard pointy fries (not a ton of nice steak fries like at other locations).  Overall, I will not be going to this location again.  For the price Red Robin charges, I am disappointed in their quality control.

All in all it's always been a pleasant experience to come here. The service is usually pretty good and I've never had a problem with the food. More often than not if I'm gonna go to red robin, I'll go to this location and not the one in southcenter as the service in general for any restaurant in southcenter is quite poor.

First of all I have called in twice for to-go only to have to wait an add'l 20 minutes past the time I was told to show up. One of two things happened: A) The person who takes the phone order is giving the wrong time... if it will take 40 minutes, don't tell me it will be ready in 20. or  B) My order was never placed and when I showed up, you started cooking. Seriously?? Then I went here last night on a  busy Friday and the table service was really bad. He kept forgetting things we asked for. More fries? no. Mandarin oranges for baby? no. A glass of sprite? no. A to go box? no. We had to ask 2-3 times for everything. I wanted to tell him to write it down and then you won't forget!!!   In the end the manager gave us a discount off our bill, so at least they made it right, but beware of bad service and go to the Landing RR!

I always like Red Robins and this one in particular.. I do not. Came here after the Super Bowl to celebrate with my significant other. I understand that it was game day and most people would hate to work, (I don't understand why because they have T.V.s) on game days, but "true colors shows at your worst." Had terrible service and was only checked once! Never got a water refill so I was choking on my food, plus their food was terrible... Super greasy and feels gross after you eat. Their shake was not cold, it was just really thick... Idk how that's even possible. This Red Robins in particular needs to change something. Management for one and the attitude people give you when you come in. I am disappointed. I will not be back.

Honey mustard.  That's probably mine and my boyfriends most favorite thing from red robins. The honey mustard sauce that you dip your fries in is so darn delicious! I came here with my boyfriend around 8 pm and they seated us in a corner. We didn't really like that we were in an isolated corner so we asked our waiter if we could be seated elsewhere and she was so sweet about it. She let us pick any table that we wanted.  Once we were seated we got our menus. They have changed quite a bit since a couple years ago. The menus are now in nice little booklets and they have a few new entrees, appetizers, and burgers for you to try.  I always get the gourmet cheeseburger whenever I come here. Cut in half, well done and with pepper jack cheese. I think this burger has a classic taste to it, and the relish is so good. However, the burgers have gotten smaller since the last time I came here, which was a year or two ago.  My boyfriend got the burnin love burger. It has a nice hot kick to it. A year or two ago, they didn't put a jalapeño right on top of the burger. Now they do. If you're not afraid of the heat, bite right into it.  In the past I have tried the tavern burger. Which is the smaller burger and the cheapest one. It has double the meat plus a lovely sauce. I actually think it's a pretty decent cheeseburger.  Then there's the ciabatta chicken burger. This was good. It was my first chicken burger that I've ever had and it was lovely. Great sauce and the bread is great.  The arctic cod burger is really good if you're craving fish n chips and a burger at the same time.  The royal red robin burger is also a treat, especially if you like a classic burger but with an egg AND bacon! Yum.  If you don't like the meats, you can also try the boca burger. Red robins does a decent job in actually making the boca burger and it doesn't taste fake at all.  However, nothing beats the unlimited steak fries. It's just so good and you always wanna ask for more. Don't be hesitant to ask for more honey mustard too. Now they give you the fries in a nice metal ring cup, but once you ask for some more they start coming out in baskets. It seems they tried to make it a bit more fancy.  Our waiter was amazing tonight in giving us excellent service. She was always there when our basket of fries were low and always asked if we wanted more. Overall though, it's your classic burgers and fries, nothing too extraordinary but still worth going to. I also recommend getting freckled lemonade if you want a drink. Nothing bears strawberry lemonade with actually strawberries in it. And for an appetizer, the tower of onion rings is the way to go. It comes with ranch and campfire BBQ sauce, both really great additions. The onion rings are breaded and fried so crisp, and the onion inside is sweet.  When I'm craving fries and honey mustard, you know where to find me.

I will not be returning again.  Our family used to enjoy coming here for a family meal out, used to have good quality and prices, but no longer.  The quality of the burgers has gone down severely, my husband ate the new Angus burger and did not enjoy it at all.  I ate the Buffalo Clucks, again, used to be my favorite, now just gross.  The fries were underdone, service was lousy and slow.  Our table was not very clean and I will not return.  This was the 3rd time it was bad and I am done.  Do not go to this restaurant.

Honestly I've been going to many different red robins for many years and this was the worst. My hostess was SO rude. Not only did she make a rude remark to my father because we asked to have our table changed due to being right by the door and we were freezing. Once we got settled at a new table, she gave everyone in my party of 4 a menu, even my little sister who's eight except for me. Then she turns and looks at me and asks me if I would like a children's menu. My family and I were so shocked and appalled, especially because I am adult. We went to the manager, my stepmother and I separately, but nothing was done except a crappy apology from the manager. The only reason why I gave two stars was for our waitress who was very nice. My advice, if your hostess is Brooke, I would leave immediately unless you would like to be treated like crap.

I give five stars for the food but ONLY two stars for the service that my friends and I received there was horrible. I had the garden burger and it was delish. I was also very, very, very, very time a million because I was using with my friend getting my birthday burger and using my red royalty card and no one sang me the happy birthday song or bring me my birthday sundae. I don't know if I wanna come back to this location. I felt like crying be treated so badly at this location!!

Sad because this was my favorite branch.  This store fell off the cliff in 2014 as far as food and service.  It appears to have a new owner and the best staff moved on.  Using the same oil for fries and onion rings is a no no especially when it could mean a doctor visit.  Tukwilla, Maple Valley, and Issaquah RRs are my favorites now.

We love Red Robin food regardless of where we go, but the service is here is not so great. This location is always super busy, and even if its not there is always some sort of wait. I recently did a to go order at the bar and waited to have my order taken, but once that was done, the service was quicker.
~I like how this place doesn't just sell burgers but other stuff like chicken, turkey and salads. I ordered the turkey croissant! Kristina our waitress was  very friendly! thank u!

I came here tonight on a date with my fiancee and our server Joe was awesome. The food was spectacular and the service was even better. I live right around the corner and will definitely be coming back.

Burnin Love Burger-- MY ULTIMATE FAVORITE! Red Robin has always been my boyfriends' & I go to burger restaurant. Busy or not, the service is ALWAYS at it's best. I always order the Burnin Love Burger and we recently just tried the Spinach & Artichoke Dip, let me just add, IT IS AMAZING! We are also have our Royalty Cards so that's always a plus cause on your 9th meal, you get a free 10th one, ABSOLUTELY FREE!

After eying several tables not yet cleared, we spied a clean one at the far corner of the bar area and sat down without any wait time. Kristina took our drink orders and we were given plenty of time to decide what we wanted to eat. It took maybe ten to fifteen minutes for our food to arrive. We had a mistake, on our part, and Kristina graciously took away the erroneous item and reordered the correct item. The correct meal arrived quickly. Additionally, I substituted steamed broccoli for the fries with my Arctic Cod. The broccoli was unadorned, plain, but just right tender. The cod was eh, the meat so bland that my normal squeeze of fresh lemon juice required dots of tarter sauce to give it taste. The batter coating was hard, not light and tender.  My husband had a burger of some form on a gluten free bun that was very good. He had no complaints, except after he took a few bites and realized some mustard would be helpful, no one was around to get some for him. The chicken in the Clucks and Fries were deliciously moist but the fries were barely crispy after a few minutes on the table. Ditto for second and third helpings of fries, no crunch. Am glad they no longer automatically pepper the fries as in the distant past. Very infrequent check-in by wait staff, although she did pay heed to the details of what we needed and made it clear we did not have to hand over payment immediately when she presented the bill. She appeared to be in a controlled, flustered state but polite.

Most Red Robins are hit or miss as far as clucks n fries go, that night this particular location was spot on! So as we were ordering our dishes I repeated something another patron sitting next to me asked for without realizing that. (Whops) Our waitress was sweet enough to take that order back to the kitchen and return a bit later with my clucks n fries. Now don't get me wrong, it was after all getting near shutting down yet they went above and beyond for our party.  Back to the clucks n fries, these chicken fingers were some of the better ones I've had there. It's always a gamble though, I've had dry clucks, I've also had what seemed to be burnt and then I get the perfectly cooked ones. You know where, you break it open for them to cool off so you can comfortably eat them? Yeah. Perfect I refuse to use the word "moist" but if I must as a describing word - yes they were moist and juicy clucks.  One star taken off because there seemed to be a shortage of fries, and apparently I didn't need refills on my beverages..

Same ol' same ol' when it comes to a R.R. experience.  Not awesome but not bad either. I felt like I was at a kids party place by how excited the server acted.  Lay of the quad shot espresso before work guy. He would form a whole paragraph of verbiage in one quick sentence.  The food tastes the same as most R.R. so that's a plus.

I've eaten here often for a few years. Unfortunately, things are on a downturn. Today the waitress asked if I'd like more fries, to which I informed her that they were stale and under cooked, so, no I would not like more. She suggested that next time I specify that I would like my fries crispy so they don't come under cooked. Wtf? I am now expected to specify that I would like to have my food prepared properly? This, combined with the fact that all of the tables are sticky all of the time, makes for a poor dining experience.

I came here with 30 other people. Our waitress was really awesome in keeping track of everyone's orders. I was at the end of the table so the people around me didn't get food until very late. Nevertheless, food was delivered eventually. It was also my birthday month and I was able to redeem my free burger. The waitress came with the rest of the crew to sing happy birthday and deliver the free sundae. The burgers here are never too amazing (unless you order the super gourmet ones) but they are edible.

Having lunch the dat before Thanksgiving. Not impressed with the lack of service, took forever to get food served. Should have seen it as a sign when we walked in and there was no hostess. Rather than having to wait to be seated, we sat in the bar. Servers were loud and seemed to drop dishes into the sink. Not likely to return here.

Its a busy black Friday here and service is great! Always hot and fresh fries! I would suggest getting the sauces if you like dipping fries in, it's worth the 75 cents. Clean and friendly this is our favorite place close to home.

Ok, I have been here a couple of times now. The service is a little slow but the staff are pretty friendly. I've been to other Red Robins and the environment seem funner but this particular location seems to be a little boring. Not sure what it is but the environment needs to be more fun. Today our waitntress name was Sandy. She was awesome, amiable, and very attentive (that's why I'm giving them a 4). + love their burgers.

I came here twice in one week, not having been here for probably a year or more. Both times our service was excellent. One of the times, we were waited on by Junior. (I can't remember the name of the second server.) Anyway, Junior did an outstanding job of listening to us. He was fantastic and our food was fixed as requested. (Unfortunately for servers, we have to customize our food choices). I was very pleased with both visits and so were my dining partners.

I ordered a A1 Peppercorn and by looking at the picture it looks huge, so I wanted to try it and when it arrived I was looking at it and I was like it looks nothing like the picture (not that saying that it should look the exactly the same in the picture, but at least something close). So I look at the menu again, and notice: it didn't come with bacon or onion straws. So I told our server and she kindly gave me what was missing and she had told me that the cook told her that they put onion straws and bacon on it but she saw it for herself because I showed her what was missing. So while I was eating it I also had noticed that it didn't have flavor and it was bitter, I didn't want to complain any longer but after eating it half way through I could no longer take it and opened it and voila inside of the bread was a little burned that gave it a bitter taste. On top of that it didn't have any A1 Peppercorn Spread at all. Like, come on are you serious 1st you forget the bacon, 2nd there's no onion straws, and 3rd you forget to put the spread? Another thing: my daughter had ordered the kids' spaghetti, and she said it tasted like wet noodles with ketchup; and that's coming from a nine year-old. I know I'm not coming back here with my family again!

6-8 cars in the parking lot, tons of empty tables and they say it is a 5-10 minute wait!   After 5 minutes someone new comes, takes our name and says it is a 5-10 minute wait.  Must be corporate policy to have customers wait. We voted with our feet and left!
Along with your Tukwila location, I've also ate at this location too, great selection of burgers with sides of fries on your menu!

want to be ignored by the staff every time you visit?  someone to mess up your order even after he asked more than once and then wait  another 25 minutes until they fix it? ... come to Red Robin in Kent.... i am done with that place.

Red Robins is always a good place to go for lunch or dinner. The great thing is it is perfect for children and adults. I try my hardest to not eat at franchise restaurants but this place was close by when we wanted to eat lunch. We were greeted very nicely in the bar section by our bartender/waitress. For drinks we ordered Blue Moon and Freshly Squeeze beer. For lunch we ordered the Barbecue Chicken Wrap with fries and the Guacamole Bacon Burger with garlic herb fries. The chicken wrap was perfect and the wrap was very good as well. I loved the garlic fries it is an additional .99 cents to upgrade so not a big deal at all. I think the best part is the extra sauces you can get to dip the fries in.  We had great service and even when our waitress went on her break she informed us and her fellow team member came and took over. If you are in a rush head over to this Red Robins for some good food and service.

Very very disappointed. ..I ordered a drink it was watered down. I asked for more sweetner did not get it. My husband asked for hot sauce and again did not receive it. The worse was our order! It was not done correctly not once but TWICE! Service was aweful I will NEVER EVER return.

Well, this one is the worst Red Robin I have been to. We waited for 10 mins to get seated. The drinks were nasty.  They didn't have the stuff to make my drinks and on top of that they made my other drinks wrong. The Ice tea was watery and someone said the sprite was bad. Food was ok tho and the waiter was good. they also claim they don't give fries while u wait but every other red robin does.

My fiance and I live right down the road from here so we stop in occasionally when we dont want to go home and make dinner. This past weekend we spent all day running errand and on the way home 9:30pm ish we thought it would be a good spot to sit and grab a quick dinner. Since it was late it was pretty slow our waitress didnt take long to get our drinks but it all went dowhill from there!  I LOVE spicy so decided to try the jalapeno coins but there were so over fried they were one big burnt clump of yuck and they didnt even bring the dipping sauce when there is a sauce holder in the rack they the app comes in (you think you would notice that right?) We got our food, I am pretty sure it was they cook that finally brought it out since our waitress was MIA. The food was good and what I expected but we had been out of drinks for 15 minutes, finally a different waitress stops in to check in us and got us some refills. We finish our meal and literally sit for over 20 minutes with NO ONE stopping by our table. A manager comes by and asked if we needed boxes, we said yes and she never comes back... A Manager!!  Our waitress reappears but not to our table, to the one behind us and we overhear her telling them that she lost their debit card. They lock the place down, seriously, because this waitress is obviously not capable of her job with a whole 4 tables to run. Another 15+ minutes and they find the card they FINALLY 35+ minutes since we have veen completely dine with our meal come back and ask again if we need boxes and we get our bill! Yay.....not quick dinner - AWFUL service!

Very slow service. There's no reason you should wait 30 minutes for a beer in the bar. All neighboring tables were covered in garbage. Completely unorganized staff. I would hate to eat there if it was busy. It's not that hard red robin staff! No napkins or silverware? Get it together! Starts with management! Recommend Applebee's or ram!

I will never goin to this red robin again.  My best friend walked into the bar and sat down at 9:55.  We saw 3 emplyees glance over at us and continue on their business.  After about 10 min of sitting there, a server by the name of Alissa came ovcer to us and told us they were closed and that th4ey close at 10.  Completely unprofessional and irritatin g tha5t they would wait until they were closed to approach us.
Let's just say the worst McDonald can do better than this Red Robin!

Ate with my grandma that uses a cane. They gave us a seat FAR AWAY from the entrance/restrooms. Thankfully, it was a floor level seat. My order was switched with another customers. I complained and was brought my correct order. However, the bill showed the original incorrect order which happened to cost more than what I got. (Did not realize this until after I paid which is my fault). Water was not refilled until after we finished our meals. There weren't that many people there so I expected better service. EDIT: Owner contacted me and we are currently in discussion. Will update if problem was resolved.  EDIT: An apology email was sent to me as well as a $20 gift certificate. Many other restaurants don't pay attention to feedback (especially ones posted online). Many others wouldn't refund so generously. After these events, I have changed my "1" rating to a "3". We will give them a second chance and I will update this post after we return. EDIT: Went back and redeemed the certificate. Service was much better this time. The place has been renovated and some food can be ordered via tablet (Ziosks). Games can also be purchased for $1.99 (totally overpriced). You also pay with the tablet with card/gift card only. We pressed the tablet button to call the waiter to pay with cash. It took 10 minutes before we were helped. Don't bother with cash.

The size of the dinner salad used to be enough for a meal but they have cut it to half the size so not worth  the amount you pay. They also took out ingredients  ... $11 for a small plate of iceberg lettuce  .. what a joke.  I will not be back anytime soon.

I went to Red Robin on 8-19-15 for lunch with my sister.  The parking lot was being renovated, however, they had no signs pointing as to where to go park.  Then we went in and the Hostess was somewhat rude.  Then the order took over 30 minutes to get to us.  Certainly not Red Robin's standards.  I only order a Cheeseburger and my sister only ordered Sweet Potato Fries.  From here on, I think my sister and I will find a different place for our once a month lunch.

Burgers are good here. You can't go wrong with bottomless steak fries either AND their honey mustard, but please when it comes to desserts go somewhere else!!!! The only decent dessert they probably have here is the Mud Pie even then it tastes mediocre. Everything else on the dessert menu is a complete waste of money. Even though they might look super good, they honestly aren't. They taste store bought and fake. Just don't even bother with their desserts.

Went here last night (Friday) night at 6:30pm, there were many people waiting for a table, it took our group of 7 about 30-40 min to be seated. It took us about 45 min to get our food. We weren't given any silverware or napkins originally and had to ask. Once our food had finally arrived we were given a total of maybe 5 sauces when we had each ordered 2-3, so had to ask for more. All of our food was room temperature by the time we got it. Pretty sure our server had forgotten about our food. One of our burgers had a rock hard bun, not sure if yelp allows videos but I have a video of us tapping it because it was so hard. Had it sent back and we were given that burger free because of that. I had my guacamole bacon burger sent back to be reheated because it was wasn't warm anymore, everyone else just decided to eat their room temperature burgers and fries. Had to ask for fries multiple times because they were taking forever, same with napkins,  strawberry lemonades, and then eventually our boxes too. The table next to us had their food taking forever too and were complaining to management. Tried to order a desert and the order was never put in by the staff person, so had to ask two people for the order only to be told probably 20 min later that they were out of ice cream for it. Everything took forever, my drink was never refilled, none of the food was that great or very warm, someone's mojito was watered down, but our server's attitude was always positive. This was my first time at red robin's in years and my boyfriend told he had a similar experience at the tacoma red robins. Won't likely be back at a red robins again.

I live close to this location and love Red Robins. I've brought family members here before as well and had a pretty decent experience most the time until lately. I was having a friend drive up from Idaho and decided to grab a bite to eat with my family and a family friend at Red Robins Kent. We had young children with us who were hungry. I had it timed out that we would be done with our food close to 2 hours before my Idaho friend came into town. I was so wrong. We ordered our meals, and an hour later, we had only received bottomless fries, which of course the kids ate all of. Our waitress ignored us and wouldn't even acknowledge us and we were the largest table there. We had the manager, who was very friendly look into it. We finally received our food an hour and 20 minutes after we had ordered. My friend from Idaho had to show up at the restaurant because we were still stuck there. There was something wrong with every single meal we had ordered, which was almost embarrassing because the kids were frustrated, my family, I was very disappointed, it was probably the worse experience I've ever had at a restaurant. The manager was kind enough to knock off a good chunk of the bill for the ridiculous wait time and poor quality food, but I will take my business to the South Center location from now on. I almost forgot to mention, the kids had a horrible stomach ache within half an hour of trying to eat their food as well. Im not sure how this location got so disappointing. Wasn't always like this.

Was on my way out of town and we thought we'd stop in at RR for a gourmet burger.  This was last Friday at 12:30 pm.  We went into the bar, because we figured it would be faster.  The bar wasn't crowded, but the booth we sat in hadn't been bused yet. A guy came by and said, "how was your meal?" We told him we just got there, so he took all the dirty dishes away.  Waitress came by and took our beverage order, water and Tea.  After about 15 minutes we got our beverages, and told her we'd like to order. Ordered 2 gourmet burgers.  40 minutes later we are still sitting there, and there seemed to be a lot of wait staff standing around discussing something. By this time other customers are trying to flag them down and inquire about their orders, or pay for whatever they had already received.  I heard the waitress say to one of them, "can't do anything about it the server is down, you'll have to wait."  Again there are RR employees standing around having a discussion about their problem.  At this point my friend went to see what was going on.  The waitress just waved her away, even though there was a whole line of burgers sitting at the cooks station.  At NO time did a manager come by and let anyone know what was going on.  By this time we had been sitting there for almost 2 hours, so we got up and left. I told the waitress we were leaving and she gave me the "shoo-fly".  So we left.   I used to patronize the RR frequently since I live nearby.  Both my son and daughter-in-law worked there while in school.  I know that RR corporation has some high standards for their employees...or they used to! This whole fiasco was ridiculous. If they would gave told us immediately about their problem, would could have been on the road 2 hours sooner. As we walked out, the greeter was turning people away....lucky them! I won't go back to this RR again. (After reading most of the other reviews, this RR must be having serious issues.  Hopefully the corporate offices will look into it.  One store can can ruin a franchise reputation.). Also, my log in says I'm from Spokane, that's because I logged on to Yelp when I got to Spokane, but I'm from Kent and live right across from this restaurant.

The food was good but I have been accustomed to the Red Robin in Redmond. Big difference between these two stores. A few issues: my name went missing off the wait list. Sat in the bar for an hour and then finally got a table. Second: Service was real slow and we were finally seated about 7:15PM. Dinner rush was over why the slow service.

Food is good.  Need to work on speed and cleanness.  Once you get sited, drinks come fast, but, took 20 minutes to order (no one stopped by until we called) and waited almost an hour for food.  Wait time is long, employees do not care! Poor management.

I do have to say.... The RE-BRANDING made a difference!!!  This place feels more grown up. Looks more grown up. Tastes more grown up! We had a party of 12 and were seated in about 20 minutes. The wait staff asked us thoroughly about our drinks and apps.  I had an issue with my Rasp-lemonade as it was too clear for my taste and was watery. On point for the most part. When ordering, the wait staff was patient and supplied new drinks and extra love for the little one that was with us. On point.  The manager came by and checked on us time and again.  On point.  The new screen machines to pay were handy, even after the wait staff had to explain it to us. Again, they had patience. However it is a little distracting to the teens as I made them actually pay attention to those at the table. (Not RR fault, teens and their screens!!!)  The avocado bacon burger I had was SUPER tasty. The sweet potato fries were SUPER tasty. The never ending steak fries were never ending!  On point.  All in all, a good evening.  I had previously banned myself from hitting any RR more than once a year, but after this tasy experience, I might reconsider.

Worst Red Robin ever. I was accused of not paying my bill when they first tried out the computers on the table verses handing your credit card to your waitress and they go and swipe your card. My food never comes out correctly and they TAAAKKKKEEE forever to bring out your food. I could understand if they weren't busy.

We came there about 3:30 on Veteran's Day.  The chain advertises free Tavern Burgers for veterans.   We walked in and sat down in a booth in the lounge--there was one waitress behind the bar.  I told her we wanted one Tavern Burger.  She nodded but then ignored us.  There were only two other customers in the lounge, so it's not as if they were swamped.  After about five minutes with the waitress ignoring us I suggested to husband that we chat with a sixty-ish vet, who sat alone at his table nearby, so we did.  We talked for a good ten minutes (still ignored by the waitress) when I walked up to the bar and asked the waitress if she had placed our order with the kitchen.  "No", she said.  "I didn't know what table you were going to sit at and I didn't know what drinks you wanted."   And you couldn't have asked?? I told her we wanted water and one Tavern Burger.   She brought the two of us one--only one-- glass of water.  Okay...do we see a little hostility here?   Another waitress came in to get drinks for her party (who were down in the restaurant proper) and she asked said waitress to bring us the burger.   Not another word.  She served a few other customers as they came in but pointedly avoided our table.   The Veteran's Day offer is supposedly to generate good will and thank the veterans for their service.  Perhaps this place ought to post a sign saying that if you don't order anything more than their goodwill offering they will treat you like crap.

These guys have the worst service ever! The people there suck at their job! And I've been their a few times and every time it's the same thing! Don't go there drive to south center if you want red Robbins!

The food was hot and tasty. We were seated right away and our drinks came super quickly so that was a plus. The dining experience was comfortable and convenient. Nothing exceptionally over the top but I am quite pleased with the experience. I would recommend for a quick lunch!

Hands down the worse Red Robin I've ever been to.  1. Our appetizer was brought at the same time as our meal.  2. There were 3 of us, my meal was brought 5 minutes after everyone else's. Even though 2 of us ordered the exact same thing.  3. We asked our server for more water, and she disappeared. We saw her entering her receipts, several minutes later we asked another server for water for 2 of us, they only brought 1. We asked a host to get our server. The server went to the table behind us. We asked another server to get our server...our server FINALLY came to our table and apologies for the wait and says it got "crazy back there" meanwhile. It's 8:30pm on a Sunday. It's not busy. And we can see you. You're not doing anything that can't wait.  4.  I ordered clam chowder to go, for my boyfriend. When I got it, it was like they took an order of their clam chowder, and then put a cup of water in it. So we asked the manager about it, and he said it was because they made the clam chowder to order, so it doesn't have time to thicken. Which I find to be a pile of bullshit. If you can't make it right, don't offer it.  We paid an astronomical amount of money for mediocre food, and piss poor service. I will never go back to this location. And this manager should be ashamed.
Aweful experience!!!! Way to loud could not hear the waiter  Slow and non attentive will never go back to this red robin

Wow, what can I say? I am not huge on negative feedback, but this experience has put me in such a sour mood I have to say something. Can't remember the waitress name but it was like Francesca or something like that. Started off well, got a table, nice greeting, had our beverages and an appetizer as we waited for our other two parties to arrive. When my party was there, she as well got them drinks and when she came back ten minutes later she took our order. Thirty minutes later we are looking around, had not seen her that whole time. After 45 minutes when she's walking by with food in our hands and seeing us looking for her, she just gives a "it'll be right up" and walks away. She finally brings out the food and it had obviously just been sitting under a heat lamp, which I don't blame any other staff for considering I saw a young man who looked like a manager running food out constantly. So basically after this, no care, just here's food. Do you know how to use the pay machine? Uhm, can you pretend to give sh** or get in a different field?

This place used to be much better. Food was ok other than the fries. Our first server forgot our order. We were presented  with a coupon for our next visit for the inconvenience of waiting through what seemed to be two rounds before getting  our food. Finally  after 20 plus minutes we were given over cooked fries that tasted like they were sitting under the warmer for a long time. Then the food was ok. I've had better at other locations.  The California  buger may have had half a teaspoon  of guacamole on it and the fries got a little better. The only reason this review gets two stars is the second server. Tina was very pleasant  and attentive. She was very  friendly  towards my niece. ( It was her 3rd birthday.)

1 star is really sad considering that the bar isn't set all that high for Red Robin to begin with.  The 30 min wait for a table was significantly shorter than our wait for a server... our drinks.............. our food.......... silverware....... refills......... The random dude in street clothes bringing my son a fork was a classy touch though.

Alright... now, normally I'm not a fan of Red Robin. The server though, made ALL the difference. Calvin was the server for our table. He handled all of our "demands" with what I'll call unnecessary speed. Which was great. He engaged us, and those around us with humor, without being the center of attention.  Nice approach and one that made my family's day.  The food appeared to be pretty standard red robin fare.... but it wasn't. It was much better than that.  We left well satisfied and very full.

Great Saturday night dinner for the family. The Black & Bleu and Shroom burgers were both hot & tasty, and the kids were happy with their basic (because they like it that way) meals. Brandon was a great server; kind and attentive.

Last night our experience here was almost comical. We sat down in the bar, and we sat there a while... I counted 7 other tables in the bar with people at them, and 5 servers. Service should be no issue.  Server came over, we ordered drinks and an appetizer. A little while longer, maybe 10 minutes our server came back and took our order. Shortly after someone else brought our appetizer, but brought no plates, no silverware, no napkins, and rushed off before we could ask for anything. So we sat there with our appetizer, unable to eat it. Another 10, maybe 15 minutes goes by, our appetizer is cold by now, and our food comes out. the server says "do you need anything else?" I said, silverware, napkins, or some plates would have been nice.. and her response was "sure thing", and she walked away. Once she brought the basic things you need to eat at a restaurant we ate our food. About halfway through the meal we asked for more fries, but after waiting more than 20 minutes and our server not coming back, or delivering any fries, we used the little check out computer and left. Worse Red Robin experience we've ever had. All three times we've been to this location the service has been terrible, but this one takes the cake.

Horrible service last night.  Drinks were forgotten 3 times as well as our dessert.  Restaurant was practically empty and we sat there over 2 hours. The fries weren't cooked all the way and were disgusting. Giving 2 stars because the waiter was funny at first but then got a bit overbearing. We sat waiting at least 30 minutes to correct our check as we were billed for someone else's food. Never going back to this location.
We have given this restaurant another chance. Must say that our experience was amazing and the Staff couldn't have been more welcoming!!  We WILL be back soon!!

I am a huge fan of Red Robin and recently moved to Kent.  This restaurant is NOT as good as the other ones I have been to.  Service was very slow and the food didn't taste as good and was very oily. We were in the bar and three people walked past us before we were ever acknowledged.  The only person that was really nice to us was the guy that served us our food. We will not be going back to this one.

This place is a joke! Our hostess was rude but we did get our seat for two pretty fast granted it was a busy night. Then our server took 10 mins to greet us I felt rushed when taking our order. He gets our drinks order wrong don't know how. It took awhile to get our food. The fries were cold and the hamburger was just covered in grease. Then my daughter had to use to the restroom at this point we had took only couple bites of our food. We come back to our table completely cleaned WTH! Manger came apologetic asking me if I want them to remake ugh no I'm not going to wait another 30 mins to get my food. He seemed he didn't even care! So yes screw this place !

The 5 stars is for Nicholas. Speedy, great service! Great taste in food (because we asked him what he'd recommend). Just a delight. Just wish LadyTightPinkShirtNoNameTag (manager? ) was a bit nicer. Her bittersweet attitude was not what we had in mind for dessert. Rude, disrespectful. We felt like we were wasting her time or something. Dont speak to adults as if theyre kids.

The front of house service here for sure saved the day. Nicc was great! Friendly and courteous checked in with us a lot and brought us out an extra basket of fries before we even asked. THAT'S HOW YOU DO IT!  I decided to try the new Ramen burger today. Meh. The patty came out well done unlike what my request, Medium rare like it should be, but I told Nicc and he was happy to take it back and remake my burger.  Manager came out to apologize and it's under the rug. Came back out medium at best but that's okay didn't make that big of a difference, and the reason why is most likely the patty just isn't very thick. Hard to do on a thin piece of meat.  The Ramen "bun" was interesting, It legit tasted like cup-o-noodle ramen without the flavor pack. I think they could have upped their game by toasting that "bun" for a little more crunch, it would add a little color and appeal to the plate as well. The aioli used was the highlight of that burger honestly, bring in more pickled carrots and daikon (like a lot more) and make the meat bigger and this might be a winning sandwich. As it stands, I wouldn't order it again. My favorite burgers here is still a tie between the blue ribbon burger and the burning love.
Always the slowest service. Food is only okay. Would not recommend for families as the staff are very inattentive.
Service was slow, good food. There is a chance for good service on the right days, and employability

I'm done with Red Robin. We've been regulars for at least 20 years at various locations. Over the years the food portions get smaller & the prices go up. Oh well, that's life.  But at least give me eatable food in a somewhat pleasant atmosphere. Last night our experience was lousy from start to finish. My hamburger arrived raw. Didn't even look like it had been cooked 60 seconds. By the time the kitchen fixed it, everyone else in our party was completely finished eating. I ended up boxing it up and bringing it home. The manager came by to check that it was cooked but never offered to comp anything.  But just as frustrating is the noise level. We couldn't hear each other and spent our dinner trying to read lips. My 5 year old daughter had to lean into my ear for me to hear her. I realize this is a family friendly restaurant but it's just ridiculous. Chuck E cheese would have been quieter. We had tables on both sides with screaming children and totally checked out parents for our entire meal.  I honestly don't know what red robin could do about this except have the manager ask the worst offenders to step outside with their kids. But I doubt they will do that.   So basically we paid $55 for a family of 4, couldn't have a conversation during dinner and I sat waiting for my food while everyone else finished.   Definitely done with this location and possibly all red robins.

I'm not the biggest fan of RR whatsoever (if you've seen my past reviews for them, I say this every time). However, this time was just to stop by for one of their beer shakes - my friend just turned 21 and she HAD to have one. The Blue Moon shake is bombbbb. Loved it.  When and if I ever do have to go back there, I'll just load up on those so I forget where I am.

What's happened to Red Robin? It used to be primarily focused on a family atmosphere. Not anymore. The nostalgic pictures and retro-America decorations came down. Giant flat screen TVs went up all over the place. They don't even call themselves "Red Robin" anymore---now it's "R&R Burgers and Brews". They'll accept children of course but the re-branding is designed to focus on adults and the drinking crowd.  I guess some damn executives decided to change classic Red Robin into a boozy sports bar. Bye bye!

So I really love the new look but I cannot help but think that the food service as well as the customer service is still the same, just ok.  We really enjoy the quality of the burgers which is why we keep coming back but it kind of gets old when you have to keep re-ordering your fries because it came out burnt or it sat too long and just taste old and then to have your server make you feel like we are a burden asking for fresh fries.  So I guess if I can change my mentality to expect a "Denny's" type service then it would be worth it for the food.

We got there at 7pm and sat in the bar area. It didn't seem too busy. Our waitress was nice but we didn't see her very often. We ordered our beers and food at the same time and we waited about 10 minutes to get our beers and another 20 ish minutes to get our food. We kept looking for our waitress so we could order more beer and had to ask the guy who brought our food for another beer and he told us he would let our waitress know. We waited another 15 minutes for more beer. I understand waiting on mixed drinks but just getting bottled beer took too long. I've been to other red robins so I know this is not the norm. Anyways, food was fine but service is ridiculously slow here.

I wish they had zero stars bc I would give this 0 stars all day... Last night was my 4th time at this location and all 4 times it was the most horrible experience ever.. We hate coming to this location but since it was late, we decide to dine in this location rather than Covington(which is the better location) since we live 5 mins down the street. We decide to sit at the bar since they weren't as busy.. (By the way... 3 out of 4 times, the bar is the worst service) As we were sitting down, a gentleman noticed our table wasn't cleaned yet... So we made eye contact, he came over and said he is not our server but he can take our drink order.. He comes back with the drinks and we asked if we can just order from him since we already knew what we wanted.. He seemed kind of hesitant and repeated I'm not your server but yeah I'll go ahead and help you since you know what you wanted to order... We asked for starter fries before our meal and his response was, "I can try but I don't know what they are doing in the kitchen.." Ummm okay....... Our server end up NEVER coming by to introduce herself or asked if we needed anything else.... About 10 mins later, she brings the table next to us starter fries.... We kindly waited for ours.. but did not receive any.. She then comes up to our table and says.. "By the way.. your food is taking a while because they messed up on the egg on the Royal Burger.. They overcooked it.." My boyfriend had to ask her, will he be taking care of us or is he.. She said " I am..." Still didn't even introduce herself. Worst experience ever...Finally got our food.. She didn't care to check on us much... We ended up leaving no tip.. I wish there was a survery I could of filled out but we wanted to get out of there so bad, we paid on the machine.. Wish this server name Leah would of known.. (We found out her name on the receipt printed from the digital device on table..) This location has poor management.. They didn't help much from the other issues we had from other experiences..
Really I can only sit in the bar if I want service because you only have one server what kind of business are you running how can you be open but not be staffed wth...

I am a firm believer in giving second chances. After the first epic failure - I decided to give this place a second chance and met up with a group of friends there. Maybe this location is just not good for groups? Or maybe their staff are hired and have to figure things out on their own? Either way - it's a disaster. The staff here are some of the slowest I've ever seen and they're not overly friendly. They are clearly more interested in chatting with each other than providing customer service. They made us feel like we was getting in their way and interrupting their conversation when we came in. After we were seated - they continued to chat in the corner instead of take our orders, bring us drinks, etc. I have GREAT experiences with other Red Robins across the US so I know it's not a company wide issue.

At Red Robin you can never go wrong amazing drinks perfect fries juicy mouthwatering hamburgers and let's not even get started with desserts. I absolutely have to come back every single time. But tonight was absolutely fantastic our server Kristina was great!!! Friendly attentive. I myself am a server and really enjoy being severed with respect joy and enthusiasm. I will definitely be back .

I usually don't take time to write reviews but I felt this one very much so deserved it. I had a long day today & it pretty much started off on a bad note...but this changed for the better when i pulled into this location. My server's name was Christina & right off the bat her upbeat attitude was simply amazing. I can't express how much I appreciated her genuine care for guests (not just myself as I noticed). I will definitely make this my regular stop when I visit friends in Covington. People like Christina are very rare to find, it's not easy to come across individuals who can sympathize with strangers. Once again, thank you for the phenomenal service!

Kent Red Robin is okay. I gave it 3 stars because of our awesome waitstaff; whether we are in the bar or at the other seating area, our waitstaff are always super helpful & attentive. Our favorite works in the bar so we always sit there unless we're w/ our daughter.  I think her name is Danielle? (I'd give you 5 stars girl)  Anyway; today we just had drinks & appetizer. We ordered the Canadian Pontine Fries. They. are. bomb. The gravy is so flavorful & thick. They pour a white cheese sauce around the fries which make it even better. There're fried cheese curds, which, c'mon, make everything better. It's amazing that some of the fries stay crunchy even after they've soaked in this thick-gooey deliciousness called "gravy" This is a clean franchise that we enjoy going to. The reasons that I took away 2 stars: #1.) I ordered a Boca Burger. Which, I have had a numerous amount of times. You know a Boca Burger by the taste, the gritty seeds and other things you feel when you munch on it. Boca burgers are yummy & can never be mistaken... Well. This wasn't a Boca burger. It was a turkey patty. I know this because of the color, taste and texture. Ground up grey meat; Turkey. I know it. Well. They served me this and tried to tell me that it was Boca. I'm sorry but we can agree to disagree. It was not a Boca Burger it was a turkey patty which I don't eat. And on another occasion I ordered the fish burger which fell completely apart (like it got defrosted too long before cooking) and I had to eat with a fork. (Boohoo, first world problems) Overall this is a nice Red Robin.  *Sit in the bar if you want faster drinks.

We had to wait at the table for about 10-15 minutes before anybody came to ask us about what we wanted to drink or even order. It wasn't overly busy, but it was still loud. I think it's just the way the building is designed that carries the sound. The food was pretty good and the fries are endless so you can eat and eat to your heart's content. Overall, this is always a decent place to eat out with the family.

Not to much to say. Love the buggers and costumer service, even when something goes wrong they apologize and fix it, I will keep coming back ! Hope they can pick up on the speed of service Lil more that would be awesome!  :-)

This is one of my go-to for burger craving. Burgers are good, and they have multiple choices depending on your mood. Fries are endless so you can eat until you want to throw up :) Service can be improve; it's a hit and miss.

Probably the worst experiences I have ever had. After having dinner and drinks and paying for our tab. As we were leaving the waitresses accused us of leaving without paying but this was not the case. She did not investigate before accusing us because It's possible that it was a different group who she was referring to. Management needs a lot of work! Will never go back

Horrible service, I can't even explain the experience I had but honestly it was a joke. I ordered a burger with bacon and My fries were displayed in such a way, it was literally just tossed onto my plate, not in those little tin holder things they're usually in. Whoever plated my food just did not give a shit. I ordered a sprite with my food and the waitress passed by my table several times without it, it was also hard to flag someone else down for a fork, another menu, more water, etc.  It doesn't make a difference if I'll be back or not because these are chain restaurants, so the employees can keep working with such shitty customer service. Wack
This place sucks buttonless fries ya right, services sucks  too this place doesn't even deserve a star

The food at Red Robin's is always awesome BUT the service is lacking. Every time we come here we have to wait a really long time to be acknowledged by a server. I use to serve tables myself. I had sixty seconds to greet my tables and that's what I expect when I go out to. The bartenders are the best thing when it comes to costumer service and Red Robin's. I will always come back though cause I can't resist there delicious burgers.

Beware of the "Entertainment Fee" for using the tablet on table. I will never use it again! They don't even tell you there is a "fee" to use it! I also ordered a well done burger and it was very pink. I got about 5 fries that looked like they were thrown on my plate. I usually go to the Tukwila Red Robin but decided to try one closer to my house. BIG MISTAKE! Why didn't I send my burger back and complain? We all know what happens when you send your food back and complain.

Haven't been to a Red Robin in years and know I now why. Ordered a Southwestern salad and the lettuce was iceberg. Who uses iceberg lettuce. The service was good, but they don't have coasters for drinks. Love having moisture drop on me. Won't go back. Asked if the outside was open and the hostess said no. After we received our food 2 people walked out and got served. Even sitting in the bar had to ask for the HH menu.
Worst dining experience I've had there so far.  The service was slow!  I had the roast beef dip and the bread was soggy. I wouldn't recommend this location.
Back for a second time. This time we got Britt...she is amazing.  Took great care of us. Food is always good. But tonight Service by Britt will continue to bring us back to this location.
Overpriced, and not many healthy options. The food tasted good. Our server was good. She refilled our tea without missing a beat!

We had a lot of people but called 35 minutes ahead and warned them . We were seated in a reasonable amount of time and then were served lunch an hour and a half later . Our server had only been there a short time and wasn't real good yet . all the burgers we ordered had been sitting so long under the heat lamp , they seemed toasted . So if you have lots of time, only a couple people and don't mind fare at best food . It would be alright  We have given this place at least 5 times to get it right .

We went for a late dinner tonight. We got there just before 9:00. There were a few other tables busy. We ordered and asked for some pink in our burgers. Both were well done. It doesn't surprise me since we could hear the cooks and servers hoot and hollering in the kitchen. They were all goofing around and were very loud. I suspect there wasn't a manager on duty and if there was, he or she should be fired! At one point we heard our server go back to tell them to quiet down because she still had customers close by. The other tables were in the other room.

We came here on Sunday 10/15 around 1:30pm for lunch. This place is a mess. I've been to many Red Robin's and this one need to get their crap together. We waited for 45 minutes and the restaurant wasn't even busy. We watched two parties leave and confront the staff on why there is such a long wait and there's so many open tables. Literally half the dining area was empty. The hostess was no help at all. Has no answers for anyone and just sat there staring at whatever she was looking at. When we finally got seated we had 3 different waiters helping us. They were late to bring out beers, late to bring out food. The table next to us sat around for 15 minutes after there were done with their food for someone to bring them a box and the waitress forgot and they left frustrated. We spent 3 hours here total! Crazy.  This place clearly needs to work out quite a few kinks.

I ordered Togo tonight Sunday 11/25 I bought a lot of food, and we ordered online so it would be perfectly in detail what we wanted without any mess ups. I get there 9: 40ish and the lobby is empty the bar was pretty empty as wel, the rest of the restaurant sounded quiet but there was no hostess and nobody acknowledged me for at least 10-15min. Once they did they asked me to go into the bar then very rudely they sent me back to the lobby for not having my ID on me when they clearly told me to go in there...... I get my food about 10 minuets later, and I start checking it because I'm already annoyed at the unprofessionalism. I was missing a side of fruit my burgers were placed wrong no big deal. Online I added garlic fries and jalapeños (extra cost) on my southern charm, it had no garlic fries or jalapeños and it was chicken instead of beef. I told the lady and she fixed it nicely. We waited at least 20 minuets to get the burger, I'm pretty sure the lady forgot and the hostess ended up handing it to us after she asked what we were waiting for. I am very dissatisfied because my meat was not cooked all the way, the feeling of it in my mouth was disgusting. They fix they're mistake and give me something not eatable in my perspective  I don't think I will ever come back, I rather drive all the way to Covington or Federal Way.....

This is usually a place where the service is great and the food is exquisite, however tonight was not one of those nights. Come out to dinner with my family and my Dad's burger was not cooked correctly, while trying to flag down a server to assist with our dilemma, they all walked by oblivious to the world around them. Is this a family friendly environment? It's starting to be put into question now. Of course the manger offered their sympathies but before they came over someone remotely turned off my server request beacon, in my opinion that was rather rude. I'm unsure the next time I will be visiting this specific Red Robin in the future. (Notice button has been on through this entire post)

I came here for lunch yesterday around 12pm and the service was far less than average that I've received at previous locations. I sat at the bar alone and waited to be greeted.  First strike- Two employees were standing in the corner gossiping/laughing for about 5min until one of the guys decide to walk over to me. "just you?", "only water?", "you ready?" - these are some of the few short brief communications that I had with the waiter. It was as if he was trying to have as little conversation with me as possible. Very non social which is fine but it came off rude.  Second strike- when he brought out my food my fries were completely cold as if they were sitting in the kitchen forever? But there was only me and two other parties in the restaurant so they weren't too busy to make a new batch of fries. Third strike- it is very off putting when you see a waiter handle money/cards/etc and then proceed to not wash their hands/wear gloves to make a customers drink and put the straw in their cup with their bare hands all over the straw. I was excited to get a milk shake and didn't order one because I saw how unsanitary their waiters are. bad experience overall.

We said we weren't going to come here again as the last few times we noticed the decline in food and service. We had a gift card so we thought what the heck. Never again!! My husband ordered clam chowder. It came thin as water and when he asked for crackers they brought him a slice of toast and said we don't have crackers!!! I ordered the four cheese melt sandwich and it was so hard it was difficult to bite into. I think my fries were the leftovers over cooked and cold. Service used to be great here but now it's lucky to be mediocre. I'm done and would rather go to Burger King than here!
